alert_logs.name: Glendon Campus: Missed Assignment (English)
alert_logs.subject: Missed Assignment in [coursename]
alert_logs.message:
Dear [firstname],    

We know that as an undergraduate student, you’re juggling a lot. We’re reaching out because you’ve missed a major assignment in [coursename]: [assignmenttitle]. Don’t fret – these things happen! Here are a few suggestions to get you back on track: 

  • Review your course syllabus for any policies on missed assignments 

  • Reach out to your instructor (or TA if you have one!) as soon as possible to let them know what happened 

Connect with an advisor

We also want you to know that you have a whole team here to support you, and so we’re also inviting you to book an appointment with an advisor at Glendon Academic Services if you have any questions or want to discuss strategies for staying on track with upcoming assignments. 
 
Other helpful resources

Looking for ways to manage your time? Study and learn more effectively? Keep up with readings and course work?  Tap into some learning skills resources to help you achieve those goals.   

Feeling like you could use some extra support outside of the classroom? Explore counselling and wellness resources designed to help you navigate challenges and thrive throughout your journey here with us.  

Still have unanswered questions? Why not chat with SAVY?  You can ask SAVY about programs and courses, student life, campus services, career development and more.   


Sincerely,   

[teacherfirstname] [teacherlastname] and the Glendon Academic Services Team

alert_logs.name: LSE: Low Grade
alert_logs.subject: Grade in [coursename]
alert_logs.message:
Dear [firstname],   

Balancing academics with other responsibilities can be challenging, and sometimes course progress can be impacted. We’re reaching out because your current average in [coursename] is around a [grade] or less, which puts you at risk of failing. You’re not alone - many students face similar difficulties, and so we want you to know that we’re here to support you with resources and guidance to help you get back on track. 

  • Reach out to your instructor(or TA if you have one) as soon as possible
  • Explore Bethune College's “Get Help” resources for options that may work for you (e.g., training, writing help, mental health and well being)


Your Next Step: Connect with an advisor

Please email us at ask@lassonde.yorku.ca to confirm you have received this message and share with us your plan moving forward in the course.

We’re also inviting you to book an appointment with an advisor at the Student Welcome and Support Centre if you have any questions or want to discuss your plan further. 


Other helpful resources

Looking for ways to manage your time? Study and learn more effectively? Keep up with readings and course work?  Tap into some learning skills resources to help you achieve those goals. 

Feeling like you could use some extra support outside of the classroom? Explore counselling and wellness resources designed to help you navigate challenges and thrive throughout your journey here with us.  

Just not the course for you? That’s totally okay—but make sure you’re informed if you're considering a drop:

  • OSAP students: Check in with a financial aid advisor.
  • International students: Speak with an immigration advisor to understand any potential impact.
  • And for everyone: Know the drop/withdraw deadlines, and what they mean for you.
Still have unanswered questions? Why not chat with SAVY? You can ask SAVY about programs and courses, student life, campus services, career development and more.  


Sincerely,  
[teacherfirstname] [teacherlastname] and your academic advisors

alert_logs.message:
Dear [firstname],   

Balancing academics with other responsibilities can be challenging, and sometimes course progress can be impacted. We’re reaching out because your current average in [coursename] is around a [grade] or less, which puts you at risk of failing. You’re not alone - many students face similar difficulties, and so we want you to know that we’re here to support you with resources and guidance to help you get back on track. 

  • Reach out to your instructor(or TA if you have one) as soon as possible
  • Explore Bethune College's “Get Help” resources for options that may work for you (e.g., training, writing help, mental health and well being)


Your Next Step: Connect with an advisor

Please email us at ask@lassonde.yorku.ca to confirm you have received this message and share with us your plan moving forward in the course.

We’re also inviting you to book an appointment with an advisor at the Student Welcome and Support Centre if you have any questions or want to discuss your plan further. 


Other helpful resources

Looking for ways to manage your time? Study and learn more effectively? Keep up with readings and course work?  Tap into some learning skills resources to help you achieve those goals. 

Feeling like you could use some extra support outside of the classroom? Explore counselling and wellness resources designed to help you navigate challenges and thrive throughout your journey here with us.  

Just not the course for you? That’s totally okay—but make sure you’re informed if you're considering a drop:

  • OSAP students: Check in with a financial aid advisor.
  • International students: Speak with an immigration advisor to understand any potential impact.
  • And for everyone: Know the drop/withdraw deadlines, and what they mean for you.
Still have unanswered questions? Why not chat with SAVY? You can ask SAVY about programs and courses, student life, campus services, career development and more.  


Sincerely,  
[teacherfirstname] [teacherlastname] and your academic advisors

alert_logs.name: SC MATH 1025:  MissedTest/Quiz (Keele)
alert_logs.subject: Missed Test/Quiz in [coursename]
alert_logs.message:
Dear [firstname],    

We know that as an undergraduate student, you’re juggling a lot. We’re reaching out because you’ve missed a test/quiz in [coursename]. [custommessage]  

Don’t fret – these things happen! Here are a few suggestions to get you back on track:  

  • Review your course syllabus for any policies on missed assessments 

  • Reach out to your instructor (or TA if you have one!) as soon as possible to let them know what happened  

Other helpful resources 

  • Did you know? Our Math & Stats Help Centre offers free, in-person support for 1st & 2nd year students Mon – Fri, from 10:00 am – 4:00 pm in Ross South 525 (Sept 15 – Dec 12) 
  • Looking for ways to manage your time? Study and learn more effectively? Keep up with readings and course work?  Tap into some learning skills resources to help you achieve those goals.     
  • Feeling like you could use some extra support outside of the classroom? Explore counselling and wellness resources designed to help you navigate challenges and thrive throughout your journey here with us.  

Connect with an advisor 

We also want you to know that you have a whole team here to support you, and so we’re also inviting you to  book an appointment with an academic advisor at your home faculty if you have any questions or want to discuss strategies for staying on track with upcoming assignments. 

Just not the course for you? That’s totally okay—but make sure you’re informed if you're considering a drop: 

  • OSAP students: Check in with a financial aid advisor. 
  • International students: Speak with an immigration advisor to understand any potential impact. 
  • And for everyone: Know the drop/withdraw deadlines, and what they mean for you. 

Still have unanswered questions? Why not chat with SAVY?  You can ask SAVY about programs and courses, student life, campus services, career development and more.    

Sincerely,    
[teacherfirstname] [teacherlastname] and your academic advisors

alert_logs.subject: Missed Test/Quiz in [coursename]
alert_logs.message:
Dear [firstname],    

We know that as an undergraduate student, you’re juggling a lot. We’re reaching out because you’ve missed a test/quiz in [coursename]. [custommessage]  

Don’t fret – these things happen! Here are a few suggestions to get you back on track:  

  • Review your course syllabus for any policies on missed assessments 

  • Reach out to your instructor (or TA if you have one!) as soon as possible to let them know what happened  

Other helpful resources 

  • Did you know? Our Math & Stats Help Centre offers free, in-person support for 1st & 2nd year students Mon – Fri, from 10:00 am – 4:00 pm in Ross South 525 (Sept 15 – Dec 12) 
  • Looking for ways to manage your time? Study and learn more effectively? Keep up with readings and course work?  Tap into some learning skills resources to help you achieve those goals.     
  • Feeling like you could use some extra support outside of the classroom? Explore counselling and wellness resources designed to help you navigate challenges and thrive throughout your journey here with us.  

Connect with an advisor 

We also want you to know that you have a whole team here to support you, and so we’re also inviting you to  book an appointment with an academic advisor at your home faculty if you have any questions or want to discuss strategies for staying on track with upcoming assignments. 

Just not the course for you? That’s totally okay—but make sure you’re informed if you're considering a drop: 

  • OSAP students: Check in with a financial aid advisor. 
  • International students: Speak with an immigration advisor to understand any potential impact. 
  • And for everyone: Know the drop/withdraw deadlines, and what they mean for you. 

Still have unanswered questions? Why not chat with SAVY?  You can ask SAVY about programs and courses, student life, campus services, career development and more.    

Sincerely,    
[teacherfirstname] [teacherlastname] and your academic advisors

alert_logs.message:
Dear [firstname],  

Balancing academics with other responsibilities can be challenging, and sometimes course progress can be impacted. We’re reaching out because your current average in [coursename] is around a [grade] or less, which puts you at risk of failing. You’re not alone - many students face similar difficulties, and so we want you to know that we’re here to support you with resources and guidance to help you get back on track. 

Your next step: Connect with an advisor

Please email us at advise.markham@yorku.ca to confirm you have received this message and share with us your plan moving forward in the course.  

We're also inviting you to book an appointment with an advisor at Markham Student Success & Advising Services, if you have any questions or want to discuss your plan further. 

Other helpful resources

Looking for ways to manage your time? Study and learn more effectively? Keep up with readings and course work?  Let Learning Skills Services help you achieve those goals.   

Feeling like you could use some extra support outside of the classroom? Explore counselling and wellness resources designed to help you navigate challenges and thrive throughout your journey here with us.  

Just not the course for you? That’s totally okay—but make sure you’re informed if you're considering a drop:

  • OSAP students: Check in with a financial aid advisor.
  • International students: Speak with an immigration advisor to understand any potential impact.
  • And for everyone: Know the drop/withdraw deadlines, and what they mean for you.

Still have unanswered questions? Why not chat with SAVY? You can ask SAVY about programs and courses, student life, campus services, career development and more.  

Sincerely,  
[teacherfirstname] [teacherlastname] and your academic advisors
